input.name: Queue Name
input.narrative: The name of the queue to add items to

input.name: Data
input.narrative: A collection containing the data, one row for each item to be added

input.name: Defer Until
input.narrative: Optionally, the date/time the new item(s) should be deferred until

input.name: Priority
input.narrative: Optionally, the priority for the new item(s). Lower numbers represent higher priorities. The default is 0.

input.name: Tags
input.narrative: Optionally, a semi-colon-separated set of tags to apply to the queue item(s)

input.name: Status
input.narrative: Optionally, the initial status required of the work queue item(s)

output.name: Item IDs
output.narrative: The IDs of the items which have been added to the queue, in the order of the collection of data passed that was input

field.name: Item ID
field.description: The Item ID of the work queue item

stage.name: Global Variables
stage.narrative: Global variables can be accessed from any page within the process.

input.name: Queue Name
input.narrative: The name of the queue to add items to

input.name: Key Filter
input.narrative: Optionally, a key value to filter by. Only items with this key value will be considered.

input.name: Tag Filter
input.narrative: Optionally, a tag mask to filter by. This can consist of any number of tag searches - each term can be separated by a semi-colon and they are all applied to the search (ie. they are AND'ed terms not OR'ed terms). For example, "Account: Joint; -Balance: Overdrawn; Card: *Visa*" will include any items which match all the terms, ie. every item must have an 'Account: Joint' tag applied, no item can have a 'Balance: Overdrawn' tag applied, every item must have a tag applied which starts with 'Card: ' and then contains the text 'Visa'.

output.name: Item ID
output.narrative: The ID of the item retrieved - empty if there are none available.

output.name: Data
output.narrative: The data associated with the item - a single collection row.

output.name: Attempts
output.narrative: The number of attempts already made to work this item.

input.name: Item ID
input.narrative: The ID of the item to mark

input.name: Seconds to Wait
input.narrative: Number of Seconds toWait.

input.name: Seconds to Wait
input.narrative: Number of Seconds toWait.

input.name: Queue Name
input.narrative: The name of the queue to retrieve the completed items from

input.name: Start Date
input.narrative: The start date from which any items marked as complete should be returned. Optional - No date indicates no start date threshold

input.name: End Date
input.narrative: The end date up to which any items marked as complete should be returned. Optional - No date indicates no end date threshold

input.name: Key Filter
input.narrative: Optionally, a key value to filter by. Only items with this key value will be considered.

input.name: Tag Filter
input.narrative: Optionally, a tag mask to filter by. This can consist of any number of tag searches - each term can be separated by a semi-colon and they are all applied to the search (ie. they are AND'ed terms not OR'ed terms). For example, "Account: Joint; -Balance: Overdrawn; Card: *Visa*" will include any items which match all the terms, ie. every item must have an 'Account: Joint' tag applied, no item can have a 'Balance: Overdrawn' tag applied, every item must have a tag applied which starts with 'Card: ' and then contains the text 'Visa'.

input.name: Maximum Rows
input.narrative: The maximum number of rows to return. Optional - No value indicates that all rows should be returned

output.name: Completed Items
output.narrative: The items which were marked as complete within the given date range, up to the maximum count if one was given

field.name: Item ID
field.description: The Item ID of the work queue item

input.name: Queue Name
input.narrative: The name of the queue for which the pending items are required

input.name: Key Filter
input.narrative: Optionally, a key value to filter by. Only items with this key value will be considered.

input.name: Tag Filter
input.narrative: Optionally, a tag mask to filter by. This can consist of any number of tag searches - each term can be separated by a semi-colon and they are all applied to the search (ie. they are AND'ed terms not OR'ed terms). For example, "Account: Joint; -Balance: Overdrawn; Card: *Visa*" will include any items which match all the terms, ie. every item must have an 'Account: Joint' tag applied, no item can have a 'Balance: Overdrawn' tag applied, every item must have a tag applied which starts with 'Card: ' and then contains the text 'Visa'.

input.name: Maximum
input.narrative: Optionally, the maximum number of items to return. Default is to return all items

input.name: Skip
input.narrative: Optionally, the number of items to skip before returning. Default is zero, ie. return all items from the head of the queue

output.name: Pending Items
output.narrative: The currently pending items in the queue, referenced by ID. The single column is 'Item ID' : text. The elements in the collection will be in the order in which they will be loaded by the 'Get Next Item' action.

field.name: Item ID
field.description: The Item ID of the work queue item

input.name: Queue Name
input.narrative: The name of the queue for which the locked items are required

input.name: Key Filter
input.narrative: Optionally, a key value to filter by. Only items with this key value will be considered.

input.name: Tags
input.narrative: Optionally, a tag mask to filter by. This can consist of any number of tag searches - each term can be separated by a semi-colon and they are all applied to the search (ie. they are AND'ed terms not OR'ed terms). For example, "Account: Joint; -Balance: Overdrawn; Card: *Visa*" will include any items which match all the terms, ie. every item must have an 'Account: Joint' tag applied, no item can have a 'Balance: Overdrawn' tag applied, every item must have a tag applied which starts with 'Card: ' and then contains the text 'Visa'.

output.name: Locked Items
output.narrative: The currently locked items in the queue. Columns are 'Item ID' : text, and 'Locked' : datetime. The elements in the collection will be in locked date/time order

field.name: Item ID
field.description: The Item ID of the work queue item

field.name: Locked
field.description: The date/time when the item was locked

input.name: Queue Name
input.narrative: The name of the queue to retrieve the exception items from

input.name: Key Filter
input.narrative: Optionally, a key value to filter by. Only items with this key value will be considered.

input.name: Start Date
input.narrative: Optionally, the start threshold date. Any items returned will have been marked as an exception after this date. If no value is given, there will be no start threshold.

input.name: End Date
input.narrative: Optionally, the end threshold date. Any items returned will have been marked as an exception before this date. If no value is given, there will be no end threshold.

input.name: Tag Filter
input.narrative: Optionally, a tag mask to filter by. This can consist of any number of tag searches - each term can be separated by a semi-colon and they are all applied to the search (ie. they are AND'ed terms not OR'ed terms). For example, "Account: Joint; -Balance: Overdrawn; Card: *Visa*" will include any items which match all the terms, ie. every item must have an 'Account: Joint' tag applied, no item can have a 'Balance: Overdrawn' tag applied, every item must have a tag applied which starts with 'Card: ' and then contains the text 'Visa'.

input.name: Maximum Rows
input.narrative: Optionally, the maximum number of rows to return. No value indicates that all rows should be returned

output.name: Exception Items
output.narrative: The items which were marked with an exception within the given date range, up to the maximum count if one was given

field.name: Item ID
field.description: The Item ID of the work queue item

input.name: Collection Name
input.narrative: The name of the collection to act upon

output.name: Count
output.narrative: The number of rows counted in the collection

exception.detail: "Queue Clear Worked Failed. There was " & [Collection Names.Number of Rows] & " items available in " & [Collection Names.Collection Name] & " collection."

input.name: File Name
input.narrative: The name of the file to check

exception.detail: "Release file containing the Queue Clear Worked work queue was not found."

input.name: Seconds to Wait
input.narrative: Number of Seconds toWait.

input.name: ID
input.narrative: The ID of the process to kill

output.name: Success
output.narrative: True if Successful, False by default.

input.name: ID
input.narrative: The ID of the process to kill

output.name: Success
output.narrative: True if Successful, False by default.

calculation.expression: [QA Root] & "\Processes\BP Commands\Queue Clear Worked\Queue Clear Worked Test - WorkQueue.bprelease"
